Hiya, folks,
 
Just thought I'd jump in (I haven't been keeping track of the list lately,
but saw this go by).
 
About the Gladiator clone/improvement/etc. on SourceForge ... if the folks
working on it (OpenGlad? :-) would like access to some or all of the source
code, just let me know.  All of the original FSGames team is tied up 150%
with Blizzard stuff, so we haven't had time to work on Gladiator in quite a
while ... so anything we can get you to help with code, we'd be happy to
supply.
 
--Tom

-----Original Message-----
From: Zardus@... [mailto:Zardus@...]
Sent: Sunday, June 16, 2002 4:21 PM
To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [gladiator] Re: Gladiator source


On Sun, 16 Jun 2002, dph_of_rules wrote:

> --- In gladiator@y..., "mogdude33" <SGriese33@a...> wrote:
> > I've got a few questions.
> > first off, what was Gladiator written in? i figured something like
> c, or c++.
>
> c++, as I recall.
>
> > secondly, is gladiator ever going to become abandonware or open
>  source? because i would be really interested in the gladiator source
>  code... just because its a really cool game.
>
> That's Tom Ricket's decision.  There are lots of things we would like
> to do to the game to fix known problems and add stuff.
>
> > and third, on sourceforge.net, theres a gladiator clone project, but
>  it doesnt seem to be developing at all. anyone know anything about
> it?
>
> That might be Gladiator:Beyond Freedom or might be someone trying to
> make a game off of the movie Gladiator.

No, its actually a clone of the original Gladiator game (ie, this one). It
was started in early april by me and a few of my friends (but then school
picked up with SATs, APs, and finals and stuff, so it got delayed till
now), and I wasn't gonna announce it until we had a half-working game
(ie, you could walk around a map). But since someone found it, I guess
I'll blurb :-)

What we're trying to do is create a clone or improved version of
gladiator with advanced level editing capabilities and network play. We
have three programmers, a graphics guy, and an idea guy, most of whom are
now on vacation. Its being written in C, using SDL for graphics and later
GTK (probably) for a level editor. It'll be made for Linux (but should
work on FreeBSD and other free unixes), but someone can port it to
Winblows if they want.

If anyone wants to help, you're welcome to contact me (and to whoever
expressed interest before the project got put on hold, sorry about that).
I'm the project coordinator there, so I can hook you up with some tasks to
do or whatever.

Right now the graphics engine is in its infancy, along with the server
(for internet play). We have most of the network protocols and data
structures planned out, and development can skyrocket as soon as there are
enough people with time to code.

So if you're interested, check it out at http://snowstorm.sourceforge.net
<http://snowstorm.sourceforge.net> 
or http://sourceforge.net/projects/snowstorm
<http://sourceforge.net/projects/snowstorm> 


- Zardus (zardus@...)


The Gladiator Mailing List
